Chalk streams are the rarest, most pristine of habitats, and this is a tragedy. Where is the regulation? Where is the stewardship? What's happening in the UK's environment is an extinction event.

Due to the massive success of July's #takeafriendfishing the @EnvAgency & Angling Trades Association have joined forces so we can ALL make it BIGGER & BETTER than ever from👉today👈AUGUST 14th right through to OCTOBER 14th!!🎣https://t.co/RLsIAWokIF https://t.co/7zObAteQPA

Great to see leaky dams installed on Crompton Moor #Oldham as part of a partnership project to #slowtheflow create habitat & improve our resilience to climate change

urls.title: Air pollution from tyres up to 1,000 worse than from exhaust, claims study
urls.description: Air pollution from car tyres can be up to 1,000 times worse than from an exhaust, research from Emissions Analytics has suggested. Non-exhaust emissions (NEE) are expected to rise from 7.4% today to 10% of all UK PM2.5…

Chalk streams are a hugely important part of our environment and it’s our job to protect them.

We recently won the #UKRiverPrize 2020 for our work protecting Hampshire's famous #ChalkStreams - the Test and Itchen rivers.

South Ferriby officers have been preparing for winter by carrying out a practice flooding training exercise.

This included testing the supply of equipment and training contractors. #Flood #Lincolnshire https://t.co/LxTNhm6rkk
